frame.name: Compatibility
frame.definition: <def-root><fen>Item-1</fen> and <fen>Item-2</fen> are compatible with each other if they can exist or function together in some context without problems, conflict, or other undesirable situation. The set of <fen>Item-1</fen> and <fen>Item-2</fen> may be expressed jointly as <fen>Items</fen>. The <fen>Degree</fen> to which the Items are compatible may also be indicated, as may be a <fen>Parameter</fen> along whose lines the <fen>Items</fen> are compatible. <ex> Make sure <fex name="Item-1">your site</fex> is <t>compatible</t> <fex name="Item-2">with any browser</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Items">Our software applications</fex> are <t>compatible</t>. </ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Item_1
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Frame Element <fen>Item_1</fen> marks the grammatically more prominent of the two entities, i.e.the subject in active clauses, when they are expressed separately.
<ex><fex name="Item_1">That technology</fex> turned out not to be <t>compatible</t> with the existing devices</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Item_2
FE.definition: <def-root>The Frame Element <fen>Item_2</fen> marks the grammatically less prominent of the <fen>Items</fen> when they are expressed separately. <ex>My computer is not <t>compatible</t> <fex name="Item_2">with my new printer</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Items
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE is used when the <fen>Items</fen> are expressed jointly in a phrase, either a plural or a coordinated NP.
<ex><fex name="Items">Your socks</fex> don't <t>match</t>.</ex> <ex> <fex name="Items">Creationism and Evolutionary Theory</fex> don't <t>jibe</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This Frame Element is used for expressions that indicate the extent to which two <fen>Items</fen> are compatible. <ex>These devices are <fex name="Degree">absolutely</fex> <t>compatible</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Parameter
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element is used for expressions that indicate a <fen>Parameter</fen> or respect in which the <fen>Items</fen> are said to be compatible, not in conflict.
<ex>The two applications are <t>compatible</t> <fex name="Parameter">in their essential features</fex>.</ex></def-root>
